unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Plant Manager | 2 of 2
question_text:
A plant manager wants to see if there are different proportions of defective items among the four machines at her automotive plant.
She randomly selects $100$ automobile parts from each of the four machines, as shown in the table below:
Suppose a fifth machine, E, was added and had $57$ defective parts out of $100$ randomly tested.
This added data will:
tables:
MachineABCD
Number of Defective Parts58615154

choices.text: Change the $p$-value somehow, but it is not obvious how exactly.
